original_transcription:
[00:00.000 --> 00:06.500]  Hello everyone, thank you guys for coming to our weekly student success meeting and let's just get started.
[00:06.500 --> 00:12.000]  So I have our list of chronically absent students here and I've been noticing a troubling trend.
[00:12.000 --> 00:17.000]  A lot of students are skipping on Fridays. Does anyone have any idea what's going on?
[00:17.000 --> 00:21.500]  I've heard some of my mentees talking about how it's really hard to get out of bed on Fridays.
[00:21.500 --> 00:26.000]  It might be good if we did something like a pancake breakfast to encourage them to come.
[00:26.000 --> 00:29.500]  I think that's a great idea. Let's try that next week.
[00:30.000 --> 00:34.500]  It might also be because a lot of students have been getting sick now that it's getting colder outside.
[00:34.500 --> 00:38.500]  I've had a number of students come by my office with symptoms like sniffling and coughing.
[00:38.500 --> 00:41.500]  We should put up posters with tips for not getting sick since it's almost flu season.
[00:41.500 --> 00:44.500]  Like, you know, wash your hands after the bathroom. Stuff like that.
[00:44.500 --> 00:49.500]  I think that's a good idea and it'll be a good reminder for the teachers as well.
[00:49.500 --> 00:54.500]  So one other thing I wanted to talk about, there's a student I've noticed here, John Smith.
[00:54.500 --> 00:57.500]  He's missed seven days already and it's only November.
[00:57.500 --> 01:00.500]  Does anyone have an idea what's going on with him?
[01:00.500 --> 01:04.500]  I might be able to fill in the gaps there. I talked to John today and he's really stressed out.
[01:04.500 --> 01:09.500]  He's been dealing with helping his parents take care of his younger siblings during the day.
[01:09.500 --> 01:13.500]  It might actually be a good idea if he spoke to the guidance counselor a little bit.
[01:13.500 --> 01:17.500]  I can talk to John today if you want to send him to my office after you meet with him.
[01:17.500 --> 01:20.500]  It's a lot to deal with for middle schooler.
[01:20.500 --> 01:24.500]  Great thanks and I can help out with the family's childcare needs.
[01:24.500 --> 01:29.500]  I'll look for some free or low-cost resources in the community to share with John
[01:29.500 --> 01:31.500]  and he can share them with his family.
[01:31.500 --> 01:33.500]  Great. Well, some really good ideas here today.
[01:33.500 --> 01:38.500]  Thanks for coming and if no one has anything else, I think we can wrap up.
